comment.body:
@ks

The second regex says to ignore all dot-files that are inside a directory whose name starts with "mp4." and which is inside the "data" folder.

When you want more than one path to be considered optional, you would write down the paths so they are separated by a vertical pipe | and the whole thing is enclosed by parentheses, like this:

	"ignore": "(data/photos/*|data/videos/*|data/apps/*)" 

This will ignore all files inside data/photos, data/videos, and data/apps.
